channel.title: Favorite and Least Favorite Chapter, Weapon in Black Mesa
channel.description:
Hello everyone , I love Black Mesa even more than Half Life, I have sunk like a 126 hours of gameplay. Anyway I wanna know what are your personal favorites and least favorites in Black Mesa. Chapters: Favorite : Apprehension It is my favorite chapter because of the Crossbow , it is my favorite weapon , 1 shot 1 kill, and I like the conversation between the two grunts that capture Gordon, Honorable Mention : Blast Pit , I love the soundtracks they are emotional and add ambiance that the situation is tragic. Least Favorite : Surface Tension it was a disappointment, I expected that you guys have finished ST with all that time. Weapons: Favorite: Crossbow as I stated above. Honorable Mention #1: Tau Cannon I love the animation how when Gordon picks it up , turns it on and the music kicks in feeling like a complete bad a**. Honorable Mention #2:MP5 I love how that thing is accurate , I used it a lot when fighting HECU marines, Alien Grunts , Vortiguants.But I prefer the older look more. Least Favorite: Glock , I like how it looks and the reloading animation but I feel like the mod version is stronger, more accurate, and faster. Dishonorable Mention: Revolver , I feel like it should have stayed 18 rounds instead of 12.
Thanks in advance. :smiley:
Note: Excuse my English errors, because it isn't my first language.

item.title: Favorite and Least Favorite Chapter, Weapon in Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: sourcegamer101
item.description:
Favorite weapon: MP5. I’ve played a lot of TF2, and have a pretty good grasp at the game, aimwise, and since aim is so easily transferable to other games, I have a easy time using the MP5. You can spray down enemies like 600 feet away as long as you can control its recoil, which is easy: Just pull down. As long as you can do that, you can abuse this weapon’s laser-like accuracy, which can be OP at times, IMO.

Runner-up: Hivehand. Mostly because of the pickup animation and general animations, but also because it’s a great utility weapon. I like breaking boxes with it, which is way faster than the crowbar. I hope the fix the missing hivehand bug soon.

Least favorite weapon: Grenades. I don’t know why the changed the arc and point of origin when thrown. These things are pretty much useless. I can’t do tricky grenade throws through small gaps anymore, because I just don’t know where to aim it or angle it. I’d like it to match HL2’s arc and point of origin.

Runner-up: Glock. It feels like I’m pelting the enemy with pebbles every time I shoot them. It’s only effective if you get headshots or use the fast fire function, which is incredibly gimmicky in itself, and only useful if you are within dick-touching distance of the enemy. I like the mod’s way of using the ‘firing as fast as you click’ approach.

Favorite chapter: Questionable Ethics. mscl-ambience8. Enough said.

Least favorite chapter: Lambda Core. I don’t like the labyrinthine style of this chapter. The only good part is the teleportation labs section.

item.title: Favorite and Least Favorite Chapter, Weapon in Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Slendgy
item.description:
Favorite Chapter: Blast Pit
I just liked how everything the player did was to accomplish one big practical goal, instead of just progressing the plot.

Least Favorite: Residue Processing
Added nothing interesting to the mix and had no memorable set pieces. Just annoying jumping puzzles.

Favorite Weapon: Tau Cannon
The build up for this weapon was probably one of the best examples of environmental storytelling. You found out how the weapon worked and what to be careful of without someone talking a tutorial at you. Hell, you didn’t even see the thing before you knew how it worked. Also it’.s got an incredibly high skill ceiling in multiplayer.

Least Favorite: The Tripmine
I’ve gotten maybe one or two kills with it in multiplayer and zero in singleplayer. Enemies would rather stand their ground than follow you around a corner to even trigger one of these useless things.

Favorite Enemy: Bullsquid
I just find them fun to fight for some reason. They take more than a couple shots to kill, and I like the radioactive splatter on my gun when they hit me.

Least Favorite: Snarks
They decide to actually try to kill something when it’s me they try to kill. They’s too small to reliably shoot and running from them isn’t fun.

item.title: Favorite and Least Favorite Chapter, Weapon in Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Agent6
item.description:
Gabe!!:

NPC-wise, my favorite is the Assassin, probably because she’s one of the only real enemies that can do serious damage on their own, moreso in numbers. You have to be constantly alert and actually “outsmart” them or you’ll be dead in moments. Also the laser eye trail is an excellent touch.

Least favorite: Zombies, can never nail them in a single shotgun blast, their head really sways around when aiming. ):

BossN00b:

Least Favorite Human: The Marines. I honestly don’t understand why so many people complained about the voice acting in the mod version. It’s simply incomprehensible for my mind. They sounded like professionals with voice filters on, but they were just perfect imo. Now they sound like a bunch of under 20yrs old idiots. They’re by far the worst human enemies I’ve ever encountered from my point of view. Don’t misunderstand, the AI seems to be pretty good, but the sounds… are just terrible.

IMO the mod version sounded like cyborgs trying to do a Batman impression, the retail actually sounds like real people, i.e., not constantly taunting Freeman or shouting about “going medieval on your ass”.

Actually I loved that line . Also I don’t think they sounded like cyborgs, very far from it. And even so, they were better then than now (imo).

Beside this, I also liked the taunts since they are supposed to be well… military, and Gordon a simple Ph.D, MIT Theoretical Physicist (that’s not to say that Gordon is not a badass ). The taunts made the combat pretty damn fun.

item.description:
Favorite NPC: Oddly, the autoturrets. I work with robotics and AI IRL, so I can sort of appreciate what would go into making something like that actually work. That, and they’re just immensely cute with those little miniguns spinning around.

Least Favorite NPC: The assassins. I just don’t get what these guys are even supposed to be. Why do they have such weird equipment? What, if any government branch actually produced them? What’s their relationship with the military? Why are they in the hangars and Lambda Complex and nowhere else? Why are they all female? Even in a game where the government runs secret teleportation labs, they just don’t make sense to me.

item.title: Favorite and Least Favorite Chapter, Weapon in Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Agent6
item.description:
Ok, my thoughts on the NPCs:

Favorite NPC(s): Vortigaunts, Gangantua, Alien Controller, Alien Grunt. Their behavior remained pretty much unchanged from HL, and it’s exactly how it should be. I’m a bit disappointed though about the vorts, I’ve been hoping for new sounds, but, they’re the same from HL2. They’re not bad as enemies et all, but could’ve been slightly better.

Also the Houndeyes seem to have a faster sound attack, compared to the HL one, which is great because it took them so long in the original game to use their attack that they rarely ever hit me, with the exception of group attacks, but even then, they wouldn’t hit me more than once. They’re much better in BM.

Favorite boss: Gargantua. Again, its behavior remained the same from HL, and it’s also looking much better. The Apache fights can also take this place (as fav.) since they’re (at least from my experience) much more challenging than in the original HL. And the assassins, they’re just as tough as in HL, or maybe even tougher, it’s somewhat hard for me to compare the BM ones with the HL ones. Some may find them very annoying due to their skill, but that’s exactly what I want. A challenge, so I have a much bigger satisfaction when I defeat them. An easy boss is not a boss after all.

Favorite Human NPC(s): Barney. Can’t really say anything here.

Least Favorite Boss: Actually I don’t have such a thing, I like all the bosses in BM, some more than others, but there aren’t any bosses that I don’t like, or at least I’m not inclined in that direction. Yes, there may be some ,ok, bosses, but I don’t dislike any of them.

Least Favorite Alien: Snarks. They’re weak and pretty much useless against enemies. Yes, you can distract the enemies with them, but they’re killed very fast, and the player needs to throw quite a lot of snarks at the enemies to actually kill someone, which from my experience, rarely occurred.

Least Favorite Human: The Marines. I honestly don’t understand why so many people complained about the voice acting in the mod version. It’s simply incomprehensible for my mind. They sounded like professionals with voice filters on, but they were just perfect imo. Now they sound like a bunch of under 20yrs old idiots. They’re by far the worst human enemies I’ve ever encountered from my point of view. Don’t misunderstand, the AI seems to be pretty good, but the sounds… are just terrible.

item.title: Favorite and Least Favorite Chapter, Weapon in Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Agent6
item.description:
Okay, here we go:

Favorite level: Questionable Ethics, mainly due to the design, experiments, and combat. Pretty much the most interesting chapter found in BM. As for HL1, I’d actually say that Xen is my fav. chapter there. The whole world is just very intriguing to me, and, unlike some people, who complain about the platforming parts, they’re not a problem for me, and I didn’t dislike them either at all, nor found them to be out of place or anything like that.

Favorite weapon: Oh boy, this one is pretty hard for me.

I’d choose either the .357 or the shotgun. I’ve never been a fan of SMGs, otherwise I would’ve chosen the MP5. It does indeed feel much better and fun to use in the actual game than the mod, although I, personally, liked the design of the MP5 from the 2012 release much more than the current one. Sadly, the reload animations in the mod were hilariously bad from my point of view, which screwed it in the end. Also I love the iron sights on the .357, I think it’s a welcomed feature.

Least favorite level: Another hard choice, basically because I just love both BM and HL and think that they’re pretty well polished. I think I’ll go for On a Rail. I prefer the original chapter from HL than the one in BM, and not because it’s bad per see, but it’s just much, much shorter. That’s why I liked the one from the original game a lot more than the current one, because I like to explore all areas in a game, which sadly, can’t really happen in BM.

Least favorite weapon: Both the Snarks and the Tripmines. The Snarks are not so useful in both BM and HL SP, but I wouldn’t go as far as to say that they’re useless. They’re just… not very well implemented in neither BM nor HL, I think their design was rushed or not well thought in HL. They can sometimes be useful to distract the enemies. As or the Tripmines, the player has literally no point to use them, in their case I’d say that yes, they’re actually useless for the SP. But, despite this, they can be very, very useful in MP if you know where to place them, but in SP, they’re worthless. Never used them in any of my playthroughs.

item.title: Favorite and Least Favorite Chapter, Weapon in Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
Enjoying the love for the MP5 here. Since we overhauled practically everything about it since the mod release, it’s become one of our favourite weapons too. Figure I might as well chip in too.

Favourite Chapter: Questionable Ethics - Come on, I don’t think anyone can argue that this chapter didn’t nail everything. Atmosphere, design, detail, gameplay, puzzles, experiments, science, the chapter long build up from having no weapons (again) to being fully equipped again? Awesome. (Uncle Horn-sama, do you love me now?). It may change to Surface Tension soon, once we’re finished with it…
Least Favourite Chapter: Lambda Core - But only because I’ve played it the least during my time at Black Mesa, especially while testing. It’s a gorgeous, beautifully designed, detailed monster of a chapter, but it just doesn’t do a huge amount for me.

Favourite Weapon: MP5 or Tau. The current MP5 is just leagues ahead of the mod release in every conceivable way, and I find it incredibly fun to shoot; while also being incredibly powerful. Whoever did the balancing for it is clearly some kind of game design genius. And the Tau too, because the new model is just drop dead gorgeous and the gun itself is just generally very fun to use. Will be even moreso when we eventually bring back the fizzy gibs™!
Least Favourite Weapon: Snarks. Don’t get me wrong, I actually adore the Snarks, the whole idea and everything about them is awesome, ESPECIALLY in MP. It’s just in SP, they never feel too useful to me.

Most Favorite Weapon- The hivehand, maybe?

Most Favorite Chapter- Anomalous Materials. To nobody’s surprise, I am a huge sucker for pre-disaster maps.
Least Favorite Chapter- On A Rail. It’s not the one I spend the least amount of time in (Apprehension is), but it’s the only map that I think the BM devs didn’t actually improve. Half-Life’s On A Rail always looked to me like a working industrial area where the Black Mesa scientists worked on satellites and rockets, and I just don’t like the more basementy approach the current version has.

item.title: Favorite and Least Favorite Chapter, Weapon in Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Sage_J_Fox
item.description:
All hard choices for this one!

Favorite Area: Questionable Ethics - I feel like this area received one of the best revisions yet in all of the facility, everything ties together beautifully while still being very faithful to the original. Also helps it’s where you pick up my
Favorite Weapon: Snarks - Adorable little buggers, and effective both for the hurtings and for playing Minesweeper. Black Mesa’s models for the snarks themselves and the nests are lovely recreations of the originals, the view model animations for them especially.

Least Favorite Area: Residue Processing - Not the fault of Crowbar Collective, but, this one does not enjoy trudging through sewage attempting to dodge more fire, ooze, and spinning blades of death than Rasputin had to deal with.

Least Favorite Weapon: Tripmine - Have yet to successfully lure one enemy into one, they just do not wish to follow. Also the bane of my existence in HL1DM (have yet to have a problem with them in BMDM. Yet.)

Honorable Mentions:
Hivehand - Another lovely recreation, love the effects with shooting. Also, its pickup has to be one of the iconic moments of Black Mesa. However, it’s currently pulling a Gordon on the devs and not showing up for work, and only sees limited use in these hands.
Anomalous Materials - So many memorable lines and references, so little time. Sets up caring for your co-workers fairly well, but missed out on the chance to pass by a retirement party.
Tau Cannon - My pretty baby, why must you have so little ammunition? Game balance is a fickle maiden.
Office Complex - Classic Half-Life here, redone beautifully. Don’t really have a negative, just love Questionable Ethics more.
